question.title: Google Play Services with Proguard in Android Studio

node.contents: I've recently move across from Eclipse to Android Studios. I had my app using Proguard via eclipse and now that I've move across I'm getting the following errors.

astNode.text: I've recently move across from Eclipse to Android Studios. I had my app using Proguard via eclipse and now that I've move across I'm getting the following errors.

elements.contents:
ProGuard: [myApp] Warning: com.google.android.gms.auth.GoogleAuthUtil: can't find referenced field 'int auth_client_availability_notification_title' in class com.google.android.gms.R$string

node.contents: What is the library used for? Hope it won't cause any ClassNotFoundExceptions

astNode.text: What is the library used for? Hope it won't cause any ClassNotFoundExceptions

node.contents: OkHttp is an alternative HTTP client, which _can_ be used instead of Android's or Java's built-in ones or not. So you definitely don't need it and it won't cause any `ClassNotFoundExceptions`. I'm using Picasso without OkHttp as well. More about OkHttp: http://corner.squareup.com/2013/05/announcing-okhttp.html

astNode.text: OkHttp is an alternative HTTP client, which _can_ be used instead of Android's or Java's built-in ones or not. So you definitely don't need it and it won't cause any `ClassNotFoundExceptions`. I'm using Picasso without OkHttp as well. More about OkHttp: http://corner.squareup.com/2013/05/announcing-okhttp.html

node.contents: For the "Picasso" library, you just have to add this to your ProGuard configuration:

astNode.text: For the "Picasso" library, you just have to add this to your ProGuard configuration:

node.contents: This is because "Picasso" has an optional library that is called "OkHttp". This is not included, but not needed, either.

astNode.text: This is because "Picasso" has an optional library that is called "OkHttp". This is not included, but not needed, either.

node.contents: For the Google Play Services, there seems to be some inconsistency with the library. You should update your library files and clean the project.

astNode.text: For the Google Play Services, there seems to be some inconsistency with the library. You should update your library files and clean the project.

node.contents: You should really have accepted the other answer and perhaps added a comment about the extra line you added.

astNode.text: You should really have accepted the other answer and perhaps added a comment about the extra line you added.

node.contents: Personally I try to use wildcards for ignoring warnings as little as possible. I agree that the answer by Marco W. is a good answer, and I have up voted it. However the code that I am using is provided in my answer, this is why I have accepted it as the answer to my question.

astNode.text: Personally I try to use wildcards for ignoring warnings as little as possible. I agree that the answer by Marco W. is a good answer, and I have up voted it. However the code that I am using is provided in my answer, this is why I have accepted it as the answer to my question.

node.contents: I ended up putting in the following lines, so that Proguard stopped warning me. The build still runs as expected.
